jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)(of a plan or pattern or behaviour) no longer exist; disappear
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（计划，模式，行为）不再存在，消失

jx.jx_en_mean: a favourable opportunity for doing something that must be seized immediately if it is not to be missed
an opportunity to attack something that is at risk (especially as a cold war claim that America's land-based missiles were easy targets for a Soviet first strike)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 脆弱之时（尤指冷战时期，美国的陆基导弹很容易成为苏联首次攻击目标的论点）

jx.jx_en_mean: organs of sense, especially the eyes

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Norse vindauga, from vindr 'wind' + auga 'eye'

entry.def: A window is a space in the wall of a building or in the side of a vehicle, which has glass in it so that light can come in and you can see out.

example.ex: He stood at the window, moodily staring out...
example.tran: 他站在窗前，忧郁地凝视着外面。

example.ex: The room felt very hot and she wondered why someone did not open a window...
example.tran: 房间里感觉很热，她纳闷怎么没人开窗子。

entry.def: A window is a large piece of glass along the front of a shop, behind which some of the goods that the shop sells are displayed.

example.ex: I stood for a few moments in front of the nearest shop window.
example.tran: 我在最近的一家商店的橱窗前站了一会儿。

entry.tran: (银行、邮局、火车站、博物馆等处柜台的)窗口
entry.def: A window is a glass-covered opening above a counter, for example in a bank, post office, railway station, or museum, which the person serving you sits behind.

example.ex: The woman at the ticket window told me that the admission fee was $17.50.
example.tran: 售票窗口那个女的告诉我入场费是17.50美元。

entry.def: On a computer screen, a window is one of the work areas that the screen can be divided into.
If you have a window in your diary for something, or if you can make a window for it, you are free at a particular time and can do it then.

example.ex: Tell her I've got a window in my diary later on this week.
example.tran: 告诉她我这周晚些时候有空儿。

entry.tran: 消失殆尽;烟消云散;化为乌有
entry.def: If you say that something such as a plan or a particular way of thinking or behaving has gone out of the window or has flown out of the window, you mean that it has disappeared completely.

example.ex: By now all logic had gone out of the window...
example.tran: 到这时根本就不讲什么逻辑了。

example.ex: When he went, our happiness and our security flew out of the window.
example.tran: 他走后，我们幸福安稳的好日子便到头了。

entry.tran: 转瞬即逝的机会;稍纵即逝的机会
entry.def: If you say that there is a window of opportunity for something, you mean that there is an opportunity to do something but that this opportunity will only last for a short time and so it needs to be taken advantage of quickly.

example.ex: The king said there was now a window of opportunity for peace.
example.tran: 国王说现在有寻求和平的短暂机会。

means.word_mean: 1. a framework of wood or metal that contains a glass windowpane and is built into a wall or roof to admit light or air
2. a transparent opening in a vehicle that allow vision out of the sides or back; usually is capable of being opened
3. a transparent panel (as of an envelope) inserted in an otherwise opaque material
4. an opening that resembles a window in appearance or function;

sentences.sentence: "he could see them through a window in the trees"

means.word_mean: 5. the time period that is considered best for starting or finishing something;

sentences.sentence: "the expanded window will give us time to catch the thieves"
"they had a window of less than an hour when an attack would have succeeded"

means.word_mean: 7. an opening in the wall of a building (usually to admit light and air);

sentences.sentence: "he stuck his head in the window"

means.word_mean: 8. (computer science) a rectangular part of a computer screen that contains a display different from the rest of the screen

auth_sentence.content: This is our window of opportunity, she said.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is our window of opportunity, she said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is our window of opportunity, she said.

means.word_mean: 窗;橱窗;窗户；窗口；窗玻璃

sentences.en: She heard a few taps on the window.
sentences.cn: 她听见有人轻轻地敲了几下窗户。

sentences.en: I saw the vase in the window of an antique shop.
sentences.cn: 我在一家古玩店的橱窗里看见了这个花瓶。

means.word_mean: 窗玻璃, 窗状开口,（商店的）玻璃橱窗，陈列窗

sentences.en: The burglars smashed the window to get into the house.
sentences.cn: 盗贼打破了窗玻璃闯进屋里。

sentences.en: The Windows allows a computer user to execute multiple programs simultaneously.
sentences.cn: Windows操作系统允许计算机用户同时运行多个程序。

jushi.english: The painter has a large studio with a window facing north.
jushi.chinese: 那位画家有一间窗子朝北的大画室。
那个球把一块窗玻璃打碎了。

jushi.english: There are no lights in the windows of the town.
jushi.chinese: 镇子中人家的窗口没有一点儿灯光。
